;;

;

;The medical care center in the Herong International Health Care Demonstration Park. Photo by Southern Weekend reporter Zhao Jilin

;

;From bank president to "scammer", Zhang Shihe's life has been like a roller coaster.

;

;Zhang Shihe is a native of Shangshui County, Zhoukou City, Henan Province, and the former vice president of a commercial bank in the county. After retirement, he joined the Henan Elderly Cultural Development Foundation (hereinafter referred to as the "Old Foundation") and was responsible for collecting private funds from the county. In the eight years he witnessed, people were able to get their principal and interest back as scheduled. Until August 2021, no more money could be withdrawn, and savers began to "visit" every now and then.

;

;At dawn on October 24, 2023, the first guest welcomed into Zhang Shihe’s home was 69-year-old Zhang Fenglan. Six years ago, she deposited the 100,000 yuan she had saved for most of her life into the Lao Foundation and became a "five-star member." Zhang Shihe is the person in charge.

;

;Zhang Fenglan’s reminder voucher is not a passbook or an IOU, but two membership certificates. The issuing organization is the Old Foundation. If you deposit money to it, you will receive consolation money, which is interest. In Shangshui County, for every 10,000 yuan saved, you can get 570 yuan/year in consolation payment, with an annualized rate of return of 5.7%.

;

;“I thought I had saved my money in the safest place, but I never imagined that something like this would happen.” Zhang Fenglan sighed repeatedly to the Southern Weekend reporter.

;

;Zhang Shihe persuaded the other party in a low voice, saying that he was also a victim and felt very guilty for "losing" everyone's money.

;

;He revealed that the entire Shangshui County involves more than 300 depositors, with a total of more than 41 million yuan in deposits. Looking at the entire Henan Province, the tentacles of the Old Foundation are everywhere. Several insiders of the old foundation revealed to Southern Weekend reporters that the old foundation may absorb as much as 500 million yuan in depositors' funds in Henan Province, involving 18 offices in Zhoukou, Nanyang, Luohe, Luoyang and other cities.

;

;On October 20, 2023, the Henan Provincial Department of Civil Affairs mentioned in its reply to Li Yazhong and others’ letter of complaint that in June 2020, the Henan Provincial Department of Civil Affairs transferred Henan Herong Industrial Group Co., Ltd. ( (hereinafter referred to as "Herong Group") suspected illegal financing-related materials were handed over to the Henan Provincial Public Security Department in the name of the Lao Foundation. The official website of the Henan Provincial Department of Civil Affairs also records that on July 28, 2020, the Lao Foundation was included in the list of social organizations with serious violations of laws and breach of trust.

;

;Many heads of old foundations confirmed to Southern Weekend reporters that under the guidance of the Henan Provincial Public Security Department, public security bureaus in many places have launched investigations into county-level old foundations.

;

;In late October, Southern Weekend reporters visited several counties and districts in Zhoukou and Luohe cities and found that the Lao Foundation used local political and private network resources to weave a huge deposit-absorbing network.

;

;How did a provincial public foundation “self-raise” such huge sums of money in the past ten years? Where do these huge sums of money ultimately go?

;

;"Network" retired cadres and farmers

;

;How to become a veteran foundation member? A "Membership Instructions" found by Southern Weekend reporters states that applicants fill out the membership application form, and after review and approval by the Old Foundation, register information and pay membership fees. After receiving the membership card, they become a formal member.

;

;Zhang Shihe said that these membership fees will be returned to members when they expire (one year), and you can also receive consolation money by presenting your membership card to the issuing agency.

;

;Membership fees are essentially deposits, and the amount is replaced by points on the membership card. Members are divided into one-star, three-star and five-star, and the corresponding points represent RMB 10,000, RMB 30,000 and RMB 50,000.

;

;The 82-year-old Lu Zhiqiang is a big customer of the old foundation and has 22 membership cards in his hand.

;

;He is a retired cadre in Shangshui County. He has a monthly pension of more than 3,000 yuan, plus a front-end house, and an annual rent of more than 30,000 yuan. He and his wife cannot spend this money. How many.

;

;He recalled that in the early days of the establishment of the Lao Foundation, Chen Zhihong, the person in charge in Shangshui County, often invited people to have dinner together to promote the Lao Foundation in order to build momentum. As a fellow villager, he even participated once.

;

;"Because it is a public foundation, I think there is no problem. Even if you deposit money in a bank for a fixed term, you don't have much money." He remembers Chen Zhihong motivating him like this, "This foundation is managed by the Civil Affairs Department, so it can't be wasted." .

;

;Lu Zhiqiang hid the deposits of the old foundation from his children, not even his wife. "If you tell them, they will stop it."

;

;Guo Fenghua, 77, is the former head of the financial section of the Shangshui County Industrial and Commercial Bureau. She has deposited 250,000 yuan in the old foundation. She only learned about the old foundation through the introduction of a retired cadre from the Shangshui County Civil Affairs Bureau. "I only knew that the interest rates were high and the certificates issued had the seal of the Civil Affairs Department, so I thought it was more reliable."

;

;"I didn't dare to tell my child at that time, for fear of exposing that my child was asking for the money. I wanted to save it so that I could hire a nanny when I get old." Guo Fenghua sighed, "It's too late to regret it now. ”

;

;In addition to retired cadres in the county, the Lao Foundation has also extended its tentacles to the vast rural areas of Henan Province.

;

;Shang Fugui, 70, is from Chengding Village, Guxiang Township, Linying County, Luohe City. He is responsible for helping the Lao Foundation collect deposits in the village.

;

;He recalled to Southern Weekend reporters that at first the villagers saved little money, "but because of the high interest rates, you saw me saving, I saw him saving, and word spread slowly." Some villagers even offered to give him cigarettes in order to do something for him.

;

;He absorbed 2.75 million yuan in funds, involving about 40 depositors, accounting for half of the village's population. There are also a few savers from other villages who are his relatives. Shang Fugui said that for every 10,000 yuan deposited, depositors can receive a condolence payment of 600 yuan per year.

;

;“Actually, we are a small bank down there.” A head of the county-level office of the old foundation told a Southern Weekend reporter.

;

;In Luohe, the old foundation showed the first signs of trouble. In October 2015, the Provincial Lao Foundation said that its funds were broken and gradually stopped local principal and interest payments.

;

;Shang Fugui recalled that after the payment was stopped, the depositors became enemies with him. Seven years later, in October 2022, he was beaten once by villagers. "Sometimes the tricycles are not dared to be released outside. They will poke holes in you and vent your anger."

;

;Every Spring Festival, Shang Fugui and his wife would run to the city. "What if I don't run away? They all gather at the door of my house to ask for money."

;

;;

;

;A depositor has as many as 22 membership cards. Photo by Southern Weekend reporter Zhao Jilin

;

;Using "volunteers" as the starting point

;

;Intermediaries such as Zhang Shihe and Shang Fugui are called "volunteers" in the old foundation.

;

;They are often retired cadres or former loan officers. Their personal status provides credit endorsement to local people. Choosing such a group of "hands-on" is also a reason why similar foundations can always grow rapidly among the people. One of the "mysteries".

;

;The second floor of No. 8 Zhengxin Street, Shangshui County, Zhoukou City is the local office of the Old Foundation. When Southern Weekend reporters visited on October 23, the place was deserted and the door was locked.

;

;Zhang Shihe said that there are five "volunteers" in the office, basically all retired cadres.

;

;Among them, Chen Zhihong is the person in charge of the Shangshui County Lao Foundation. He once served as secretary of the Party Committee of Tangzhuang Township in Shangshui County and deputy director of the Propaganda Department of the Shangshui County Party Committee. Zhang Shihe is the former vice president of a commercial bank in Shangshui County. The other two "volunteers" have served in the Shangshui County Finance Bureau and the Procuratorate respectively.

;

;A former staff member of Weiji Township Government in Shangshui County told Southern Weekend reporters that he and Chen Zhihong are fellow villagers. I often sit at the same table with Chen Zhihong during meetings in the county. I am familiar with her, so I also saved some money. "He is not like a liar, he is a very down-to-earth person."

;

;In a criminal verdict obtained by Southern Weekend reporters, Yang Yiting, a "volunteer" at the Linying County Office in Luohe City, mentioned in his testimony that the old man When the foundation's Linying office was established, the director of the office, Xue Xiaoge, came to him and said that the provincial old foundation hoped to find a local cadre with prestige, good popularity, and retired cadre to serve as the honorary director. "The foundation is engaged in charity. Shang Qi had been retired at home for two years and wanted to do something."

;

;Xue Xiaoge confessed that Yang Yiting was the former political commissar of the Linying County Public Security Bureau and the honorary director. "When there is an event, he takes part in it. He doesn't usually go to work."

;

;In addition to retired cadres from government agencies, former rural loan officers are also an important force for the old foundation to sink into the rural market.

;

;70-year-old Feng Junfu is a villager in Guzhuang Village, Daguo Town, Linying County, Luohe City. In 1975, he was elected as a loan officer of Daguo Township Credit Union by the Guzhuang Village Committee and worked there for 34 years until 2009. Get fired.

;

;Feng Junfu said that township residents are accustomed to depositing funds in local rural credit cooperatives or township banks, and loan officers play the role of handling business for villagers.

;

;“Loan officers must first be ideologically progressive, trustworthy by the people, and have no stains.” Feng Junfu told Southern Weekend reporters that there are 20 old foundation “volunteers” in Linying County, most of whom have worked as loan officers in township banks. , and people from all over the country regard them as their "own people" who are worthy of entrustment.

;

;In March 2013, Xue Xiaoge found Feng Junfu and showed him the approval document of the old foundation from the Henan Provincial Department of Civil Affairs, the foundation’s legal person certificate, tax registration certificate, organization code certificate, etc., saying that it was formal. organization and invite him to join.

;

;“The most important thing is that we have depositor resources in our hands.” Feng Junfu told Southern Weekend reporters that he thought about staying in his old business and the process was roughly the same, so he readily agreed. In Guzhuang Village, Feng Junfu developed more than 50 villagers into members of the Lao Foundation and collected a total of 1.85 million yuan in savings.

;

;The Provincial Veterans Foundation stipulates that for every 10,000 yuan taken in, 300 yuan will be set aside for "volunteers" and another 200 yuan will be used for office expenses of the county and district offices.

;

;Origined from the Henan Song Qing Ling Foundation

;

;Tracing back to the source, the old foundation is inextricably linked to the Henan Soong Ching Ling Foundation (hereinafter referred to as the "Henan Song Qing Ling Foundation").

;

;As early as 2005, the Henan Song Foundation collected deposits from villagers in the name of public welfare medical insurance. (See Southern Weekend’s September 2011 series of reports on “Where is the Money of China’s Most Fundraising Charitable Organization—Who Controls the Henan Soong Ching Ling Foundation”)

;

;In February 2013, the old foundation officially It was established and Lu Dawei was appointed as the president. According to the Henan Provincial People's Government website, Lu Dawei served as assistant to the governor. In addition, Southern Weekend reporters learned from the Henan Song Foundation website that he is also the vice chairman of the Henan Song Foundation.

;

;A county-level person in charge of the old foundation revealed that the management method of the old foundation is under the leadership of the president, with the secretary-general taking responsibility.

;

;The person in charge told Southern Weekend reporters that Guo Jianxin is the secretary-general of the Old Foundation and is responsible for the overall work, while the deputy secretary-general Huang Yuejun is responsible for specific work. "Huang Yuejun turned out to be from the Song Foundation. Basically, we follow the management style of Song Foundation, otherwise we wouldn’t be able to get this thing done.”

;

;In interviews with reporters from Southern Weekend, we found that most of the county-level directors of the old foundations had working experience in the Henan Song Foundation. After the Henan Song Foundation's savings-absorbing business ceased, Guo Jianxin and Huang Yuejun recruited these people. "In the past, we were all familiar with the business at the Song Foundation. Huang Yuejun gave us advice and introduced us to the old foundation," the person in charge said.

;

;On October 30, a reporter from Southern Weekend contacted Huang Yuejun by phone. The other party said that he had left the Lao Foundation at the end of 2015 and was currently residing in a nursing home in Sichuan Province. He did not know much about the past and then hung up. Disconnect the phone.

;

;Liu Cuiyun was originally a depositor of the Henan Song Foundation. After the Song Foundation ceased its deposit-taking business, she withdrew the original 100,000 yuan from the Song Foundation and transferred it to the old foundation. Then save another 50,000 yuan every year until 450,000 yuan. "Generally (every year) I don't ask for the principal, I get the interest, but I add some money to make up 50,000 and deposit it again."

;

;

;

;Left-hand foundation, right-hand open Company

;

;Tianyancha shows that the Elderly Foundation is located in Zhengzhou City, Henan Province, and its purpose is to "promote the development of social welfare, culture, sports, education and other undertakings for the elderly in Henan Province." Access to the foundation’s official website is currently closed.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters obtained a reply from the Henan Provincial Department of Civil Affairs on the establishment and registration of the Henan Provincial Elderly Cultural Development Foundation (Yu Min Han [2013] No. 47). According to the "Foundation" According to the provisions of the Management Regulations, after review, the old foundation, which was donated a total of 4 million yuan as the original fund by Guo Jianxin, meets the conditions for establishing a public foundation. It is hereby approved to register and obtain the legal person status of the foundation in accordance with the law. Its business supervisory unit is Henan Provincial Department of Civil Affairs.

;

;In November 2023, Southern Weekend reporters repeatedly contacted the Henan Provincial Department of Civil Affairs to verify many issues regarding the old foundation, but no one answered the relevant calls. Inquired through "12345", but still no reply after waiting for many days.

;

;For many savers, they are willing to deposit money in the foundation. On the one hand, they trust the "volunteers", and on the other hand, they see the business scope on the foundation's legal person registration certificate. On this certificate issued by the Henan Provincial Department of Civil Affairs, the business scope reads "raising social funds in accordance with the law and carrying out elderly cultural activities such as loving and helping the elderly."

;

;In the eyes of many savers and "volunteers", being able to "raise social funds in accordance with the law" means that they can legitimately accept deposits.

;

;A search shows that many foundations do mention "raising social funds in accordance with the law" in their business scope. For example, the business scope of the Henan Province Yellow River Cultural Foundation is “raising funds in accordance with the law, rescuing cultural heritage, and establishing cultural undertakings”; the business scope of the Henan Province Youth Entrepreneurship and Employment Foundation is “raising funds in accordance with the law, subsidizing youth entrepreneurship and employment, and conducting research on youth entrepreneurship, etc. "Related social charity activities"; the business scope of the Henan Province Old District Construction Foundation is "raising funds in accordance with the law and supporting poverty alleviation".

;

;Lawyer Zeng Jie of Guangdong Guangqiang Law Firm told Southern Weekend reporters that there is an essential difference between raising funds and deposits. Deposits mean a commitment to guarantee principal and interest. “The foundation can absorb funds from the society within its business scope. However, returns cannot be promised, and projects that repay principal and interest are not allowed.”

;

;He explained that deposit business requires a formal banking license. The old foundation used consolation money instead of interest without approval, which is a disguised form of absorbing savings.

;

;;

;

;The business scope on the registration certificate makes depositors and volunteers think that saving money here is "natural". Photo by Southern Weekend reporter Zhao Jilin

;

;On November 29, 2021, the Linying County Court of Luohe City convicted the Henan Elderly Cultural Development Foundation of illegally absorbing public deposits, sentenced it to a fine of RMB 200,000, and ordered the elderly to Participants in the foundation's compensation fund-raising raised 29.71 million yuan, and Henan Herong Industrial Group Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "Herong Group") bears joint liability for compensation.

;

;What is the relationship between Herong Group and the Lao Foundation?

;

;As the secretary-general of the Lao Foundation, Guo Jianxin is also the chairman of Henan Herong Elderly Care Industry Group and was once the major shareholder of Herong Group.

;

;Tianyancha shows that Herong Group was established in 2010 and is an enterprise mainly engaged in business services. On March 15, 2010, Guo Jianxin, as the major shareholder, participated in 90% of the shares for the first time. Another shareholder, Wang Shuling, is also a member of the board of directors of the Lao Foundation and holds 10% of the shares.

;

;"To put it bluntly, Herong Group and the Lao Foundation are one and the same to the outside world, but in reality they are the same." A person close to Guo Jianxin told Southern Weekend reporters that there are people under the Lao Foundation and Herong Group. Division of labor, top management is a group of people.

;

;The registered office address of Herong Group is also the same as that of the Old Foundation.

;

;On March 5, 2013, the Lao Foundation and Herong Group officially signed a letter of authorization. The Lao Foundation will authorize Herong Group to invest in projects with the raised funds to ensure the maintenance and appreciation of the funds.

;

;An investigation by Southern Weekend reporters found that in order to avoid supervision, most of the private funds absorbed by the old foundation went through personal accounts.

;

;As can be seen in a criminal verdict, the financial personnel of the Provincial Veterans Foundation are Zhang Xiaodan and Wang Jie. Wang Jie is responsible for receiving funds (resigned in September 2015), and Zhang Xiaodan is responsible for disbursing funds.

;

;Zhang Xiaodan mentioned in his testimony that the Provincial Veterans Foundation has bank cards in its offices in various counties and districts. The bank card account names are all the names of provincial and ministerial personnel, and most of the funds are transferred through China Construction Bank. Yes, a small part is transferred through ICBC and Postal Savings Bank of China. After the various offices in the county and district paid dues, Wang Jie transferred the money to the Herong Group's account.

;

;"Wang Jie swiped directly from the POS machine at the foundation headquarters and transferred it to the account given by Herong Group." Zhang Xiaodan saw Wang Jie transfer like this with his own eyes.

;

;Zhang Xiaodan said that the foundation transfers the dues transferred from each office to Herong Group. "This is the case every day." Any money received is transferred to the company and transferred to his personal bank card. superior.

;

;Judging from the available annual reports of the old foundation, from 2014 to 2016, the donation income was 300,000 yuan, 460,000 yuan, and 270,000 yuan respectively, and the corresponding public welfare expenditures were 25,000 yuan. Ten thousand yuan, 220,000 yuan, 360,000 yuan. But by 2017, both donation income and public welfare expenditures were 0.

;

;This means that the huge "membership dues" of the old foundation did not go through the foundation's public account, but were transferred privately through personal bank accounts.

;

;"If a lawsuit is filed and we check the public account of the Old Foundation, we will find that there is no money from us in the account. The public account of the Old Foundation only accepts donations. Depositors' money cannot be added to it. Even if it’s a donation,” a county-level head of an old foundation told a Southern Weekend reporter.

;

;Huge sums of money flow into real estate

;

;From a province-wide perspective, the difficulties faced by the old foundation in repaying funds are concentrated in the second half of 2021. But there are early signs of bank-run difficulties.

;

;In 2014, guarantee companies and investment companies in Henan Province went bankrupt on a large scale. "As soon as they closed down, the old foundation was also affected." An insider close to Guo Jianxin told Southern Weekend reporters that one year after the establishment of the old foundation, the capital chain began to break.

;

;The person revealed that from August to September 2015, depositors began to withdraw money from the county offices of the Old Foundation on a large scale. "Not only the customers were panicked, but the directors and volunteers of the Old Foundation offices were also panicked." .

;

;A person in charge of a county-level office recalled that in October 2015, Guo Jianxin, the head of Herong Group, said at a meeting with county-level leaders that the company had debts and that the funds could not be paid temporarily. , let everyone go back and wait, and protect themselves first. "We didn't tell the depositors when we got back, thinking it would be fine after a while." In order to repay the interest to the depositors, we also asked relatives and friends for help, did not hesitate to borrow money, and even sold the house, paying more than 1 million yuan in interest to the depositors. It wasn't until 2021 that he couldn't survive anymore, then he confessed to savers and stopped paying interest.

;

;"There is no way, in order to encourage depositors to continue depositing. If we stop (payment), we will have to go to (jail). Will ordinary people be willing to not pay interest?" The person in charge of the office said that if we continue to do so, Those who went down were paupers and were in debt.

;

;On February 20, 2023, Herong Group issued the "Explanation on the Inability to Redeem the Funds Raised by the Henan Elderly Cultural Foundation on Time", saying that it held a meeting to study and decide that the payment will be made from the end of February 2023. 10%-15% of the funds will be paid, and 20%-25% of the funds will be paid at the end of February 2024; 30%-35% will be paid in February 2025, and the rest will be paid at the end of 2025. However, the above promises have never been fulfilled.

;

;Where did the money go? This is the mystery lingering in the minds of savers and "volunteers".

;

;Yi Jiadong is the legal representative of Herong Group. He confessed in a criminal verdict that "Herong Group invested in two real estate projects in Mengzhou City in Jiaozuo and Yuanyang County in Xinxiang , invested in an apartment project for the elderly in Zhengzhou Port District, and also invested in a real estate project in Shangqiu City. All the social funds raised by the Lao Foundation were used in these projects."

;

;Among them, the Zhengzhou Port District project is Herong International Health Care Demonstration Park (hereinafter referred to as "Health Care Park") is considered to be the benchmark project of Herong Group.

;

;Public information shows that Kangyangyuan is located at the southwest corner of the intersection of Yingang Avenue and Ruyun Road, Airport District, Zhengzhou City. The total land area is 41,398.22 square meters, the total construction area is 76,754.40 square meters, and there are 2,000 designed beds. It mainly constructs 6 elderly apartment buildings, 1 comprehensive service building, 1 elderly research center building, and 1 elderly medical care center building.

;

;Feng Chunlai is the head of a county-level office of the Lao Foundation. On September 15, 2022, he was elected as the director of Kangyangyuan.

;

;He revealed to Southern Weekend reporters that the elderly care projects in the port area are positioned as high-end and have received the attention of many local leaders. There is a lot of room for imagination in the future. In addition to construction subsidies, bed subsidies, and nursing subsidies, the land price also has advantages compared with other investors. "I heard that the land price in Zhengzhou Port District was more than 2 million yuan per acre, but here it was only a few hundred thousand. At that time, the house price was 10% per year. growth, this alone will not make us lose anything."

;

;However, its construction was not smooth. Feng Chunlai said that the construction of Kangyangyuan started in 2016, but due to environmental problems such as dust and noise, the superior authorities asked it to stop construction. It was not until December 18, 2019 that the first phase of the park was successfully opened. According to the Henan branch of CCTV, Lu Dawei and Guo Jianxin also delivered speeches at the opening ceremony.

;

;Feng Chunlai revealed that the main construction of the nine buildings of the senior care project in Zhengzhou Port District was completed in 2018, but due to financial constraints, there has been no renovation. At the beginning of 2019, eight county-level offices under the old foundation established project promotion teams to continue to collect deposits from the society and provide loans to renovate Buildings 5 ​​and 4. The remaining seven buildings have not yet been renovated due to funding problems. "If we don't renovate the building, this place will collapse long ago."

;

;Today, about 80 elderly people live in the No. 5 complex. However, as of now, the Kangyangyuan has not yet been inspected and has not obtained a business license.

;

;Multiple people familiar with the matter confirmed to Southern Weekend reporters that in the second half of 2022, Guo Jianxin and several company managers were arrested by the public security organs for involvement in other cases. Subsequently, the offices of the Old Foundation and Herong Group were moved from No. 8 Shangdu Road, Zhengdong New District to Kangyangyuan.

;

; "Now almost no one is working in the Old Foundation and Herong Group. They come if they have something to do, but they don't come if there is nothing. They basically go back to their homes." An insider of the Old Foundation said that No. 5 in Kangyang Garden The second floor of the complex building was originally the office space of the bosses, but now it is hard to find anyone.

;

;On October 30, a reporter from Southern Weekend contacted an external relations director of Herong Group as an investor. He said that Kangyangyuan currently still has debts of more than 200 million yuan, of which the construction work is in arrears. The team's project payment is less than 100 million yuan, and the other more than 100 million yuan is funds collected from some elderly customers before the epidemic and needs to be refunded.

;

;Feng Chunlai said that Kangyangyuan currently has 30 employees and spends 200,000 to 300,000 yuan a month. The largest expense is water and electricity bills. Although we can collect 3,700 yuan per month from each elderly person, "it's basically not enough, and we are trying every means to delay and owe money."

;

;Can this retirement apartment make money to replenish the principal of the old foundation’s depositors? They can't think that far ahead. At the moment, the operations here are barely surviving on the money of the elderly living in retirement apartments.

;

;(At the request of the interviewee, Zhang Shihe, Zhang Fenglan, Lu Zhiqiang, Guo Fenghua, and Liu Cuiyun are pseudonyms in the article.)

; Wed, 08 Nov 2023 12:25:04 +0800 消失的课间十分钟，学校何以成樊笼：“绝对安全”发生学丨快评http://www.infzm.com/contents/260132
;;2023-11-08 11:00:00;
;

;In response to the "disappearing ten minutes between classes" for primary and secondary school students in some places, the Ministry of Education stated that it will resolutely correct it to "ensure The practice of simply restricting students’ necessary recess and activities on the grounds of “student safety”. Subsequently, some schools began to respond, such as media reports: The bell rang, and Dang Xinlong, the vice principal of Shanhaitian Experimental Primary School in Rizhao, Shandong Province, kicked out the students who were still in the classroom.

;

;However, this chronic disease has been infiltrated for a long time, is widespread and deep, and I am afraid it cannot be cured by a single statement. Article 8 of the "School Protection Regulations for Minors" that will be implemented on September 1, 2021: Schools shall not set up management measures that infringe on students' personal freedom, and shall not impose any restrictions on students' legitimate communication, games, or activities during recess and other non-teaching time. Unnecessary restrictions are placed on freedom of speech and behavior such as classroom activities. The target is the "disappeared ten minutes between classes". The problem is that it is difficult for students to make their own decisions. No school believes that it is "unnecessary" to restrict students from leaving the classroom, the teaching building, and the playground during recess. So, the problem remains to be solved.

;

;Beiqing.com recently reported that a parent said: If children want to leave the classroom during recess, they can basically only go to the toilet and get water. They are not allowed to talk loudly or run or jump on the way; some "loose" schools , the child will be allowed to walk in the corridor and cannot go up or down stairs or to the playground; in more serious cases, the child can only stay in the corridor of his own group and cannot cross the boundary.

;

;Another media reported in July this year that in Beijing, primary schools generally strictly limit the scope and intensity of students’ recess activities. The reporter randomly visited 27 schools in the central city and found that at least more than 20 schools have strict restrictions on students’ recess activities. restrictions on activities during the period. In addition, some schools in Zhengzhou, Henan, Baoding, Hebei and other places have adopted similar regulations, including not being allowed to leave the teaching building, not leaving the classroom, and not allowed to speak loudly or play around inside or outside the classroom.

;

;When I was a child born in the 70s and 80s, I could go out for ten minutes between classes to skip rope, play shuttlecock, hopscotch, play freely and even chase each other, letting go of my nature; outdoors, in the playground, be quiet or active No matter what, it is always suitable, with the blue sky above your head, your feet on the earth, let the sun hit your face, let the breeze blow on your face, and be close to nature, which can instantly rejuvenate and heal the body and mind, and also cultivate simple, strong and resilient character and values.

;

;And now, while restricting or even prohibiting children from leaving the classroom, leaving the teaching building, or going to the playground for even ten minutes between classes, they still naively ask: Why are our children so mentally fragile? Why are our boys so fragile? A general lack of masculinity? Isn't this funny? How can we become strong physically and mentally if we are not even allowed to chase, play and fight? Where does masculinity come from?

;

;How did this distorted philosophy and practice come to be? On June 1, 2021, the Director of the Department of Physical Health and Art Education of the Ministry of Education responded to CCTV: "We are afraid that students will be easily injured once they move. Now all schools put safety first... This can also be said to be a failure to eat due to choking. ." Viewed in this way, the pursuit of "absolute safety" and its mechanism are worthy of analysis and reflection.

;

;First of all, some parents have problems and believe that the school should be responsible for any personal injury to their children while in school. This imposes unlimited liability on the school. Not to mention that schools can’t do it, parents themselves can’t do it either. Theoretically, there is no one in the world who is more concerned about the safety of their children than parents, but under the care of parents, there are endless incidents of children being injured or even killed. No one wants to see something like this happen, but the world itself contains various known and unknown risks, and we cannot make anti-human demands on schools.

;

;Furthermore, identifying risks, preventing risks, responding to risks, and coexisting with risks are an integral part of everyone's life, and they are also the basic education that every child must learn to grow up. Very young children do not know what risks are. Of course, they must be kept away from risks and isolated as much as possible. However, children are constantly growing and need to learn the skills to identify, prevent and respond to risks as they grow. This is the most important survival skills education. In a way, it is much more important than knowledge education. And so many schools actually succumb to the ideas of some parents of students and strive to build schools into an absolutely safe space that is isolated from any risks. To this end, they do not hesitate to suppress children's love of freedom and love of play. This is anti-education in itself and also In vain.

;

;Secondly, there will always be some weird parents who want to blackmail the school financially when their child has an accident at school, even though it is clearly not the school’s responsibility. But this is not the crux of the problem. The key lies in how schools, education authorities, public prosecutors and law respond.

;

;If these three parties can handle the matter according to its merits and legal principles, it will not be the responsibility of the school. The school will not shoulder the responsibility, and the school will not let the school shoulder the responsibility. He Xini will resolutely fight back those who mess around. In this way, righteousness can rise and decent values ​​and correct incentives can be established. Does the school still need to engage in "absolute security" that is anti-education and anti-human?

;

;Obviously it was not the school’s responsibility, but due to the parents’ unreasonable fuss, the school had to compensate the loss on its own or under the pressure of superior departments. This is a bad incentive for some parents who have evil intentions or like to shirk responsibility. In order to avoid another hemorrhage, the logical approach for schools and education authorities is to restrict children's freedom of movement, confine them to the smallest possible space, and approach the "absolute safety" that isolates all risks. This is the root of the problem. .

;

;To a certain extent, this is a social issue and a conceptual issue: children who cry have milk to drink. Whoever has a louder voice and can make more noise will get greater benefits. This phenomenon is still prevalent in public opinion and in all walks of life. "I am weak and I am reasonable", "I am making trouble and I am justified" and "I am loud and I am justified" have become unspoken rules. Pretending to be weak, being miserable, and using the weak to bully the strong has created another jungle. The children locked up in the classroom are just another group of victims of this jungle law.

;

; Wed, 08 Nov 2023 11:25:02 +0800 记者节之思：新闻理想的坚守与开拓http://www.infzm.com/contents/260074
;;2023-11-08 10:00:00;
;

;The annual Journalists’ Day is here. This is also the time for reporters who are working non-stop and running around all year round to stop and reflect. , an important moment for self-examination.

;

;Today's world is full of chaos, the century-old changes are accelerating, the media field is deeply integrated and reconstructed, instability and uncertainty factors are significantly increasing, internal and external factors are stirring in the hearts of journalists... At this moment, Journalists' Day, Perhaps each of us journalists should ask themselves the question: Do you still have journalistic ideals?

;

;For a journalist, the news ideal is the "beacon light" that guides the direction; the news ideal is the "engine" that drives forward; the news ideal is the "ballast" "Stone" has the function of calming the mind; news ideal is the "regulator" and has the function of prompting and warning.

;

;However, today, the traditional journalism industry is facing an unprecedented industry shock: the circulation of newspapers and periodicals and radio and television ratings have declined, and the influence of the media has declined; the media industry has operating difficulties, and the income of news practitioners has decreased. ; The number of people leaving their jobs has increased, and people quitting the industry have been heard from time to time; the number of enrollment in journalism and communication majors in colleges and universities has been reduced, and the employment situation of graduates has become tighter... There is no shortage of comments on the Internet about candidates who plan to apply for the journalism and communication major. Although it is not without bias, This is by no means groundless.

;

;In the founding words of "Xiangjiang Review", Mao Zedong enthusiastically asked: "What is the biggest problem in the world? The biggest problem is the problem of food." When the traditional journalism industry is climbing up and over the hurdles, a group of people who are confused and emotionally anxious have emerged. Psychological Inevitability – Will Traditional Journalism Die? Is there a future for journalism? Do we still need journalistic ideals?

;

;As long as we carefully study the history, reality and future development trends of journalism, we will find that traditional journalism will not disappear. Journalism still has its own future, and we still need journalistic ideals. This is because: From the perspective of the origin of journalism, news originates from people’s curiosity. As long as people’s curiosity does not die, journalism will not disappear. From the perspective of the evolution of journalism, although the carrier of news is constantly changing, the functional role of journalism has not disappeared. However, compared with the traditional ways of reading newspapers, listening to radio, and watching TV in the past, people now obtain news in a different way. It’s just a new carrier such as a mobile phone. From the perspective of audience needs, news focuses on meeting people's communication needs. As long as people's communication needs exist, the demand for journalism will always exist. From the perspective of journalism production, the authoritative news, in-depth reports, news reviews, elegant programs and other products provided by traditional media cannot be replaced by the vast number of new media and self-media. Therefore, traditional journalism is unlikely to disappear in any of the above senses.

;

;Since it is impossible for traditional journalism to disappear, it is impossible for journalists to disappear. The ideal of journalism will inevitably accompany and advance together with journalists. Otherwise, we will lose our way and lose our way. Without motivation, lack of soul, and chaos, you will be at a loss, useless, muddle along, and do nothing. Therefore, in such a special context of the times, each of us journalists must still have journalistic ideals in mind, promote journalistic ideals, adhere to journalistic ideals, and practice journalistic ideals.

;

;Always have a loyal heart. Loyalty means that as a journalist, don’t ask what the country has done for me, but ask what I have done for the country; loyalty means not being confused in the face of major events, not wavering at critical moments, and being able to withstand various complex situations and problems. The test; loyalty means being indifferent to fame and wealth, willing to work as a coolie, working hard, sweating, and traveling thousands of miles for the cause of journalism, and striving to become an excellent journalist.

;

;Always maintain a keen sense. Sensitivity is an essential quality for professional journalists. Only journalists who are sharp-minded, have unique vision, are good at seeing the subtleties, respond quickly, and have a sharp eye can effectively improve the dissemination, guidance, influence and credibility of news and public opinion work.

;

;We must always practice seeking truth. The world-famous journalist Farage once said: "The duty of a reporter is to reveal the truth." In an era of widespread media communication, despite the excess of news information, real news is always valuable. We should always maintain the spirit of truth-seeking, practice truth-seeking skills, and provide the public with truth, true knowledge, true feelings, and truth in a timely and rapid manner in the turbulent world of massive information.

;

;Always hold the ruler of justice. Some people say: "The reporter's pen contains countless fortunes, reputation and reputation, loyalty and villainy, right and wrong, and life and death." This shows how heavy the journalist's pen is. Therefore, we reporters should be very clear about why we write, what we write, how we write, and to what extent we write. We must always grasp the yardstick of "fairness" and must not be influenced by some kind of power, money, or interest relationship. Those pens soaked in grease and booze can't possibly do them justice. This is why we need to always be in awe of "justice".

;

;On the occasion of Journalists’ Day, I wish every journalist’s journalistic ideals to be evergreen and never wither!

;

;(The author is from the media in Hebei)

; On the morning of November 7, 2023, the State Council Information Office held a press conference to introduce the progress of the reform of the fire rescue system. Southern Weekend reporter Li Guitu)

;

;"Firefighting work and the construction of fire rescue teams have undergone all-round and profound changes." On the morning of November 7, 2023, at the State Council At a press conference held by the Information Office, Qiong Se, member of the Party Committee of the Ministry of Emergency Management and director of the National Fire Rescue Bureau, introduced the construction and development of the national comprehensive fire rescue team in its fifth anniversary.

;

;In October 2018, the public security fire brigade and the armed police forest brigade retired from active service and were formally placed under the Ministry of Emergency Management to form a national comprehensive fire rescue team.

;

;Qiong Se said that in the past five years, nearly 200,000 teams have successfully completed transfers of subordinates, identity changes, rank changes, title changes, and official positions. work, establish the National Fire Rescue Bureau, implement unified leadership and hierarchical command, clarify the major principles of central construction and local use, and establish a dual management system that combines sections and focuses on sections.

;

;2023 is the sixth year for open recruitment of firefighters after the establishment of the national comprehensive fire rescue team. Li Shangyu, head of the Education and Training Department of the Ministry of Emergency Management, said that there was a plan to recruit 15,000 people in 2023, but nearly 110,000 people signed up, marking the fourth consecutive full recruitment.

;

;Li Shangyu introduced that the average age of new firefighters is 21.8 years old, and 52.6% have a college degree or above. They are currently undergoing a one-year induction training. So far, the total number of firefighters recruited after the transformation has reached more than 94,000, accounting for 65.3% of the total number of existing firefighters.

;

;;Forest firefighting adds more than 8,200 people;

;

;National firefighting After the rescue bureau was officially established, a new mobile team was formed. Xu Zhongshun, deputy director of the National Fire and Rescue Bureau, said that this is "a major decision made based on the basic national conditions of my country's frequent natural disasters."

;

;Xu Zhongshun said that as a critical force in national emergencies and major disasters, the mobile team is mainly responsible for forest and grassland firefighting duties, supplemented by flood fighting and earthquake and geological disaster rescue. Responsibilities, task arrangements focus on fire fighting in winter and spring, flood control in summer and autumn, year-round disaster relief, seasonal cross-regional garrison, and implementation of preparatory operations.

;

;The National Fire and Rescue Administration has integrated the forest fire corps and related fire and rescue mobile detachments, forming 10 cross-regional fire and rescue mobile corps and several detachments, brigades, and squadrons.

;

;Among them, the original establishment of forest firefighting teams is 25,000, mainly deployed in 10 provinces including Inner Mongolia, Jilin, Heilongjiang, Fujian, and Sichuan. On this basis, the Central Organization Office has approved the establishment of more than 8,200 forest firefighting teams, mainly to strengthen the first-line firefighting and rescue mobile forces in key forest areas, national parks, seven major river basins and surrounding areas across the country, and to achieve comprehensive coverage of 31 provinces. "Full coverage" of all administrative regions.

;

;Xu Zhongshun said that as of now, 17 provinces in the first batch of additional mobile teams have basically completed their deployment, and are now organizing the second batch of additional mobile teams. There are teams stationed in 3 provinces.

;

;;"All disasters, major emergencies" ;

;

;Firefighting After the rescue team was reformed and transformed, its functions have also been expanded.

;

;Qiong Se introduced that on the basis of the original fire fighting and emergency rescue focusing on rescuing people's lives, the National Fire and Rescue Bureau focuses on "all disaster types". The comprehensive rescue expansion of "big emergency" covers urban and rural and forest and grassland fire fighting, as well as disaster accident rescue such as floods, earthquakes, geology, typhoons, building collapses, and hazardous chemical leakage.

;

;Taking 2022 as an example, fire rescue teams across the country received reports and handled 2.092 million disasters of various types, including 824,000 fire rescues and 469,000 emergency rescues. , 597,000 cases of various types of social assistance, 126,000 cases of official duties, and 76,000 cases of other dispatches.

;

;In this total number of rescues, fire fighting is still the main type of accident that the fire rescue team responds to. At the same time, police situations involving water areas, mountains, production and equipment failures, trapped elevators, and traffic accidents accounted for 87.4% of the total number of rescues. "They are the main types of rescues and are also the key directions for the expansion of functional tasks after the reform and restructuring."

;

;Qiong Se said that in response to these situations, in recent years, the National Fire and Rescue Bureau has vigorously strengthened the construction of professional forces and established a total of high-rise buildings, underground spaces, large commercial complexes, etc. There are more than 3,500 professional firefighting teams in the body and petrochemical enterprises, as well as earthquake, water, air, and rain, snow and ice rescue teams. Relying on the forest firefighting team, 12 special disaster rescue brigades and 55 affiliated rapid response teams have been established.

No current student in this laboratory has contracted cancer. The specific situation is as follows: ;

;

;;Huang, female, studied for a doctoral degree in our hospital from 2017 to 2022, during which she studied in the laboratory of the Breast Cancer Center, and graduated with a doctoral degree in July 2022 Later, he joined the Breast Surgery Department of our hospital and engaged in clinical work. ;

;;Liu, male, studied for a doctoral degree in our hospital from 2013 to 2018. During this period, he studied in the laboratory of the Breast Cancer Center. He joined our hospital after graduating from the Ph.D. in August 2018. Breast surgery, engaged in clinical work. In June 2023, he was diagnosed with synovial sarcoma and underwent surgery. He recovered well after the operation. ;

;

;;After the above two employees became ill, the hospital has been caring about their health and organized expert consultations, visits and condolences. ;

;Wanding Town resident Wu Xia took pictures of the war in Myanmar from the rooftop. The houses with blue roofs in the distance are in Myanmar. Photo provided by the interviewee

;

;On the fifth day of the civil war in northern Myanmar, Wu Xia, who lives in the border town of Wanding, was so scared when she heard the sound of gunfire not far away that she turned off the iron Snack bar, hiding in a home made of reinforced concrete. Having lived in Wanding for more than 20 years, she told the Southern Weekend reporter that there had been wars on the opposite side before, with mostly gunshots, but the fighting in 2023 was the most fierce, all with heavy shelling.

;

;Wu Xia climbed to the roof of her house, where she could see Myanmar across the river. In a 39-second video she shot, the sound of gunfire and artillery continued from the valley, and helicopters circled the top of the mountain. At the foot of the mountain were dense houses, stretching from Myanmar to the eastern town of Ruili City, Yunnan Province.

;

;On October 27, 2023, government army strongholds in many places in northern Myanmar were attacked by armed forces and exchanges of fire broke out. The fighting was fierce and the stalemate has continued to this day. On the national border, Wanding Town, which borders Bangsai Town in Myanmar, is a Chinese town that has been greatly affected by the war. Stray bullets have fallen into this town of about 10,000 people many times. In order to ensure the safety of residents, the local government arranged for school closures and mobilized residents to leave the town to avoid the war. The town implemented a "only exit, no entry" control policy, and even the town government staff evacuated to work in safe places.

;

;;

;

;Wanding Town is located on the border of China and Myanmar. Drawing by Liang Shuyi

;

;“Don’t come out of your home”

;

;On the morning of October 28, a shell from Myanmar hit a residential building in Wanding Town, destroying the top four floors. A big hole was blown out of the building. A few hours after the explosion, Mr. Yang, who sells aluminum doors and windows, rushed to the scene out of curiosity. He told Southern Weekend reporters that the shell had exploded and there were no casualties. “An old lady told me that when the shell exploded, It was so shaken that she couldn't hear anything for two hours."

;

;

;

;When Peng Qi first heard the sound of shells and gunshots, she didn't know what they were. She thought someone was setting off fireworks. In June 2023, she was transferred from Ruili City to Wanding Town and worked as a store manager in a chain milk tea shop. The locals told her that it was the sound of war in Myanmar and comforted her: "It's okay, we hear this sound every year."

;

;The locals who are used to the sound of gunfire seem to be also attracted by it. This time the battle was frightening. At two or three o'clock in the morning on October 29, Wu Xia was awakened by several gunshots while she was sleeping. That day, she listened to the sound of gunfire outside and judged that the exchange of fire between the two parties was fierce. The windows of a house about 200 meters away from her home were shattered.

;

;Wuxia Snack Shop sells some local specialty snacks, such as Pauluda, fried bait cubes, etc. It is only about 200 meters away from Wanding Port. Children in the third grade of primary school are afraid that artillery shells will penetrate the iron sheet and will go home when they hear the sound of artillery fire. Wu Xia believes that hiding at home is not necessarily safe. "If there are really shells coming, you can't hide anywhere."

;

;Tao Wan, who lives by the boundary river, seems to be at greater risk. She once saw a picture of a helicopter bombing on the other side of the river on a short video platform. The community administrator also kept telling her not to come out of the house. However, She works at Wanding Town Health Center and still needs to report to work.

;

;Tao Wan recalled to Southern Weekend reporters that on October 31, she was at work when she was suddenly informed that a large crater had been blown up near her home, and her son, who was in primary school, was staying at home alone. "It was really urgent at the time. I called my husband and ran home. When I got home and opened the door, I saw that my son was taking a nap." Tao Wan looked at her son sleeping soundly and felt, "My heart is going to be broken." ".

;

;Tao Wan told Southern Weekend reporters that when she was a child, the sound of fighting on the other side of the river could be heard in Wanding Town. The most intense year." The scene of community workers and street broadcasts telling residents to retreat and avoid the fighting made Tao Wan feel panic like never before, "I felt like I had to leave this home."

;

;Many interviewees told Southern Weekend reporters that on October 27, the night when the war broke out, community members came to persuade them to leave: “If you have family and friends in Ruili, go to Ruili. "Not only that, the community also informed that if you hear the sound of gunfire, please do not go out, and immediately find shelter to take shelter. Do not wait and see out of curiosity, and avoid exposing your body in open spaces to avoid being hit by stray bullets.

;

;On November 3, an on-duty staff member of the Wanding Town Government told Southern Weekend reporters that the staff in the government building had moved to a relatively safe place to work, leaving only a few on-duty staff, and the new place was still open. Within the Wanding area, it is five or six kilometers away from the town government building. The reason why they moved out of the town government building was because the building was "directly opposite Myanmar and posed a major safety hazard." The person on duty said he was unclear about how many people were transferred in Wanding Town and when students would resume classes.

;

;;

;

;Town The fourth floor of a residential building was hit by a shell, but fortunately there were no casualties. Photo provided by the interviewee

;

;The watermelon business chain is broken

;

;Residents living in Wanding noticed that this war was different from usual signals. In addition to the fierce gunfire, there were also Students are completely suspended from classes. The milk tea shop where Peng Qi works is only a few hundred meters away from Wanding Middle School. She discovered that on the evening of Friday, October 27, all the high school students who were originally on holiday on Sunday were taken home by their parents. Wu Xia's snack bar is not far from the middle school. She saw many parents driving to the school gate to pick up their students.

;

;Cai Lili, a 21-year-old girl who grew up in Wanding, recalled that there was an emergency in the local area a few years ago when classes were suspended due to the war in Myanmar, but she could not remember the time clearly. She only remembered that it was the same time at that time. There are stray bullets flying into the territory. "The most serious thing in recent years is the two incidents of stray bullets flying over. The situation in Myanmar has always been unstable. Once war starts, Wanding's geographical location is destined to be affected."

;

;In Cai In Lily's impression, there is only a boundary river two or three meters wide, and there are frequent exchanges between Wanding and the Myanmar town of Bangsai on the other side. She recalled that when she was five or six years old, it was easy to travel to Myanmar from the border crossing. When she was in primary school, seven or eight of the more than 40 students in her class were from Myanmar. "We all studied Chinese courses and we all played together." The boundary river is also one of her recreational areas. She often goes fishing and picnicking by the river with her family and friends. A walking trail is built close to the boundary river, and Wanding residents often go for walks by the river.

;

;Tao Wan confirmed to Southern Weekend reporters that some Wanding residents were indeed accidentally injured, mostly with skin injuries. "After we debridement, we will ask them to go home quickly, because the hospital is located on a relatively high ground and is not safe. Some people were also transferred to higher-level hospitals by ambulances."

;

;Wu Xia discovered that since the beginning of the Northern Myanmar War Later, there were fewer and fewer people on the streets, especially tourists. As a famous border town and border port, there are endless tourists here all year round. Her snack bar is not far from the national gate and has about a hundred customers every day. But after the war broke out, only a few old customers who lived nearby came to the store, and "there was no one on this street." Not only that, on October 30, the "only go out, no go in" rule was implemented in the central area of ​​Wanding Town. However, according to locals, the rule was only implemented for two days.

;

;Peng Qi also obviously felt that the flow of people had dropped sharply. In an interview with a Southern Weekend reporter at 16:00 on November 2, Peng Qi said that the store's turnover that day was only more than 100 yuan, which is the price of about 10 cups of milk tea, and most of the customers were from nearby shops. Before the war, the store's daily turnover was about one thousand yuan. There are also brave tourists who go to the border to shoot short videos. Wu Xia said: "Many men and women may also be afraid. They basically just take pictures and leave."

;

;Among the men and women Wu Xia saw, Perhaps there is also Zhou Feng, a melon seller. On November 2, 37-year-old Zhou Feng also visited the national gate of Wanding, but his destination was the Wanding Watermelon Wholesale Market. As the largest watermelon market in Southeast Asia, from the end of October to May of the following year is the time when Myanmar watermelons are on the market and exported to China. Zhou Feng revealed that during peak periods, the market could have 1,000 vehicles a day, each carrying 16 tons of watermelons.

;

;At the end of October 2023, the price of Myanmar watermelon that has just been launched can reach four or five yuan per kilogram, which is not low. After the war broke out, Wanding's national gate was closed and watermelon could not enter the territory. Zhou Feng analyzed that the most affected people in the watermelon industry chain are melon farmers. The price of contracted land in Myanmar is relatively low, only three to four hundred yuan per mu, so most of the people who plant watermelons on contracted land in Myanmar are Chinese. Zhou Feng has been engaged in this industry for 13 years. He is grateful that it is the early stage of the watermelon market. "If it takes more than a month to start the war, I will be annoyed."

;

;;

;

;In previous years, the watermelon wholesale market in Wanding was full of melon stalls Watermelons imported from Myanmar. Oriental IC Picture

;

;"Eerily Quiet"

;

;Not all Wanding residents were affected by the war.

;

;There are 3 communities and 3 administrative villages within the jurisdiction of Wanding Town. 26-year-old Guo Yu lives with his family in Hunban Village, which is about 5 kilometers away from the border port and one or two kilometers away from Myanmar. Guo Yu runs a B&B. Since the war started, there have been no guests staying. Fortunately, the shells did not fall near them, and the family's food, clothing, housing and transportation were not affected.

;

;Guo Yu’s mother is from Myanmar, and his father’s ancestral home is in Baoshan City, Yunnan Province. When they were young, they came to Wanding to buy land and build a house, and settled here. Guo Yu told Southern Weekend reporters that his grandmother's house was not affected by the war and was relatively safe for the time being. Guo Yu also feels safe and has no plans to move away. However, if the shells hit nearby, the family may move to Ruili, 20 kilometers away, and stay with relatives.

;

;Tao Wan was not prepared to evacuate, but sent her youngest son back to her husband's hometown in Dehong Prefecture overnight. "We all buy a house and a car on our own. This is my home. If I leave, it won't even have its roots." Since October 27, Tao Wan has felt uneasy every day. She is afraid that if an accident occurs, the house will be lost. . "I don't know what to do in that situation. When I think of this possibility, I almost burst into tears."

;

;Tao Wan came to Wanding Town with her mother when she was 5 years old. Now she has Is 40 years old. Because she had to take care of her mother who didn't want to leave Wanding, Tao Wan, who went to college abroad, came back here again, until now. After the war broke out, Tao Wan placed her mother in a village far away from the border. She planned to wait until the war calmed down before taking the old man home. Tao Wan said that there are some elderly people in the town who have inconvenient legs and feet who are unwilling to move. They have deep feelings for Wanding.

;

;In Dai language, Wanding means "the place where the sun is at the top". Today, the town's shine is no longer dazzling. In Tao Wan's impression, Wanding was prosperous 20 to 30 years ago. Later, due to road planning, administrative divisions and other reasons, Wanding was slowly declining. Tao Wan felt aggrieved for the small town where she lived, "There was an epidemic in the past three years, and now there is this war."

;

;Cai Lili never felt that she was a girl who came out of a small town. She felt that Wanding was more like a small city. She remembers that Wanding Town was very lively around 2007, with people coming and going, and the shops on the street would sell Myanmar specialties, such as hot and sour noodles, milk candies, etc. Now, some of the shops that impressed Cai Lili have been closed, and many shops on the street are empty. "After its decline in recent years, I gradually felt that it was really just a small town." Cai Lili said.

;

;Now, this town is facing another test. On November 6, Peng Qi told Southern Weekend reporters that compared with the chaotic sound of gunfire in the past few days, the streets in Wanding are now "eerily quiet". Except for the occasional pedestrian passing by, only military green trucks are left on the street. patrol.

;

;Tao Wan has not heard the sound of gunfire recently, but she feels that the government departments and schools have shown no signs of relaxing. The school has not notified the resumption of classes, teaching is conducted in the form of online classes, and the community still counts every day and has not evacuated. resident information.
